ANU.name: Le Zhang
interest: Dr. Zhang's research interests include corporate finance and international finance, particularly mergers and acquisitions, corporate governance, and banking.
ANU.biography: Dr. Le Zhang is Senior Lecturer of Finance at Australian National University. Dr. Zhang works at the intersection of corporate finance, investment, and political economy, with a focus on understanding how the frictions in financial market and institutions influence the corporate decision making. His research has won Pearson Prize for the Best Paper in Financial Management and has been published in leading academic journals such as the Review of Financial Studies and Journal of Financial Intermediation. He teaches corporate finance for undergraduate, postgraduate, MBA, and Executive MBA program.

ANDS-Grants.description: This project aims to determine whether and how time constraints affect decision-making. Time constraints can impair the quality of decisions in health, resulting in serious medical and financial consequences. This project will employ experimental economic methods to examine how misaligned preferences and incentives influence decision-making under time constraints. The project will offer scientific evidence and accurate measurements, provide insights into interventions to align the preferences of doctors and patients, and to lower the overtreatment of patients in the health-care market. The project expects to benefit society and contribute to a more efficient healthcare system.
ANDS-Grants.title: Discovery Early Career Researcher Award - Grant ID: DE190100887
